item.description:
Organizational meeting begins at 6:00 pm.

Fabled Enemies is a 2008-film by Jason Burmas, who was also a filmmaker for the Loose Change 9/11 films. In this film, Burmas investigates the events of September 11, 2001. Bypassing the mountains of proof that demolitions took down the towers, and focuses more on how the crime was organized and by who.

7 years after 911 the supposed mastermind behind the attacks is still at large, and the nation is entrenched in multiple Wars in the Middle East.

Is Bin Laden the Evil behind the attack or a mere front man in a larger picture, a Bogeyman?

We are told we are fighting a War on Terror, and that the Terrorists hate us for our freedom. If that is the case, why do our leaders take more and more of those freedoms away every day?

The film program begins at 7:00 pm with a following discussion. [film running time 102 minutes]

There is a possibility that Jason Burmas will be available to join with us for the program.
item.how_to_find_us: Will be at the community meeting space, back of building behind Woodstar Cafe
item.name: Fabled Enemies - film and discussion
